intro: Thalictrum foetidum subsp. nevadense, commonly known as the Sierra smutflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as meadows and forest understories. It has slender, branched stems and compound leaves with small, ovate leaflets. The flowers are usually clustered in loose inflorescences and are pollinated by insects.
